Clipboard.onCopy: The onCopy event is triggered when the user copies content from the clipboard.
Clipboard.onCut: The onCut event is triggered when the user cuts content from the clipboard.
Clipboard.onPaste: The onPaste event is triggered when the user pastes content from the clipboard.

Composition.onCompositionEnd: The onCompositionEnd event is triggered when the user finishes composing text.
Composition.onCompositionStart: The onCompositionStart event is triggered when the user starts composing text.
Composition.onCompositionUpdate: The onCompositionUpdate event is triggered when the user updates the composition of text.

Keyboard.onKeyDown: The onKeyDown event is triggered when a key is pressed down.
Keyboard.onKeyPress: The onKeyPress event is triggered when a key is pressed and released.
Keyboard.onKeyUp: The onKeyUp event is triggered when a key is released.

Focus.onFocus: The onFocus event is triggered when an element receives focus.
Focus.onBlur: The onBlur event is triggered when an element loses focus.

Form.onChange: The onChange event is triggered when the value of an element changes.
Form.onInput: The onInput event is triggered when the user enters input into an element.
Form.onSubmit: The onSubmit event is triggered when a form is submitted.

Mouse.onClick: The onClick event is triggered when the user clicks an element.
Mouse.onContextMenu: The onContextMenu event is triggered when the user right-clicks an element.
Mouse.onDoubleClick: The onDoubleClick event is triggered when the user double-clicks an element.
Mouse.onDrag: The onDrag event is triggered when an element is dragged.
Mouse.onDragEnd: The onDragEnd event is triggered when an element's drag operation ends.
Mouse.onDragEnter: The onDragEnter event is triggered when a dragged element enters a drop target.
Mouse.onDragExit: The onDragExit event is triggered when a dragged element leaves a drop target.
Mouse.onDragLeave: The onDragLeave event is triggered when a dragged element is dragged out of a drop target.
Mouse.onDragOver: The onDragOver event is triggered when a dragged element is being dragged over a drop target.
Mouse.onDragStart: The onDragStart event is triggered when a user starts to drag an element.
Mouse.onDrop: The onDrop event is triggered when a dragged element is dropped on a drop target.
Mouse.onMouseDown: The onMouseDown event is triggered when the user presses a mouse button over an element.
Mouse.onMouseEnter: The onMouseEnter event is triggered when the mouse enters an element.
Mouse.onMouseLeave: The onMouseLeave event is triggered when the mouse leaves an element.
Mouse.onMouseMove: The onMouseMove event is triggered when the mouse moves over an element.
Mouse.onMouseOut: The onMouseOut event is triggered when the mouse moves out of an element.
Mouse.onMouseOver: The onMouseOver event is triggered when the mouse moves over an element.
Mouse.onMouseUp: The onMouseUp event is triggered when the user releases a mouse button over an element.

Selection.onSelect: The onSelect event is triggered when the user selects text or elements.

Touch.onTouchCancel: The onTouchCancel event is fired when a touch point is disrupted in some way, such as when the user moves their finger off the screen or if an external event, like a phone call or text message, interrupts the touch event.
Touch.onTouchEnd: The onTouchEnd event is fired when a touch point is removed from the screen, such as when the user lifts their finger off the screen.
Touch.onTouchMove: The onTouchMove event is fired when a touch point is moved along the screen, such as when the user slides their finger across the screen.
Touch.onTouchStart: The onTouchStart event is fired when a touch point is placed on the screen, such as when the user touches the screen with their finger.

UI.onScroll: The onScroll event is fired when the user scrolls an element, such as a webpage, using a scrollbar or touchpad.
UI.Mouse Wheel: The Mouse Wheel event is fired when the user scrolls an element using a mouse wheel or trackpad.
UI.onWheel: The onWheel event is fired when the user scrolls an element using a mouse wheel or trackpad, similar to the Mouse Wheel event.

Media.onAbort: Fires when the loading of an audio/video is aborted.
Media.onCanPlay: Fires when the browser can start playing the audio/video.
Media.onCanPlayThrough: Fires when the browser estimates it can play the audio/video to the end without stopping for buffering.
Media.onDurationChange: Fires when the duration of the audio/video is updated.
Media.onEmptied: Fires when the current playlist is empty.
Media.onEncrypted: Fires when the media data is encrypted.
Media.onEnded: Fires when the audio/video has ended.
Media.onError: Fires when an error occurs while loading an audio/video.
Media.onLoadedData: Fires when the browser has loaded the current frame of the audio/video.
Media.onLoadedMetadata: Fires when the browser has loaded meta data for the audio/video.
Media.onLoadStart: Fires when the browser starts to load an audio/video.
Media.onPause: Fires when the audio/video is paused.
Media.onPlay: Fires when the audio/video has been started or is no longer paused.
Media.onPlaying: Fires when the audio/video has started playing.
Media.onProgress: Fires when the browser is downloading the audio/video.
Media.onRateChange: Fires when the playback speed of the audio/video is changed.
Media.onSeeked: Fires when the user has finished moving/skipping to a new position in the audio/video.
Media.onSeeking: Fires when the user starts moving/skipping to a new position in the audio/video.
Media.onStalled: Fires when the browser is trying to get media data, but data is not available.
Media.onSuspend: Fires when the browser is intentionally not getting media data.
Media.onTimeUpdate: Fires when the current playback position of the audio/video has changed.
Media.onVolumeChange: Fires when the volume has been changed.
Media.onWaiting: Fires when the video stops because it needs to buffer the next frame.

Image.onLoad: Fires when the image has been loaded.
Image.onError: Fires when an error occurs while loading the image.

Transition.onTransitionEnd: Fires when a CSS transition has completed or been interrupted.
